page.title: 18FARMING: ANIMAL DISEASES
page.content: A local veterinerary surgeon gave this information about prevalent diseases in cows and sheep. {Mastitis:}This affects the udder causing inflammation and pain.The cure is strict hygiene and penicillin and other antibiotics. {Staggars:}Is a disease which makes the magnesium level drop in the victim.The cure is to inject the cow with a magnesium solution. {Lungworm:}Occurs when the worms nest in the trachea and the victim coughs up. The larvae migrate through the liver and kidneys.The cure is an injection which helps to stop it spreading. {Bloat:}The cows, when left out at pasture, over-eat and the gases blow them out.This is cured by putting a hollow needle in the flank or a rubber tube down the throat.
